Package com.chatapp.services

Class UserManager

java.lang.Object
com.chatapp.services.UserManager
public class UserManager extends Object
Centralizes the management and operations related to users within the Chat Application. The UserManager class provides a cohesive set of methods for registering users, authenticating user login/logout sessions, and interfacing with the underlying database for user data persistence and retrieval.

The class streamlines user registration by assigning unique user IDs using an atomic counter. It maintains the session's current logged-in user and serves as a gateway for all user-related operations, ensuring the application's front-end user functionalities synchronize seamlessly with the underlying database.

Author:
Prutha Upadhyay

  • Method Details

    • getRegisterUsers

      public List<RegisterUser> getRegisterUsers()
      Returns a list of all registered users in the system.
      Returns:
      A list containing all registered users.

    • generateUserId

      private int generateUserId()

    • registerUser

      public void registerUser(String name, String userName, String password)
      Registers a new user within the system and persists their data in the database. After successful registration, the newly registered user is set as the current active user for the ongoing session.
      Parameters:
      name - Display name of the user.
      userName - The unique identifier chosen by the user for logging into the system.
      password - The authentication password specified by the user.

    • login

      public RegisterUser login(String username, String password)
      Attempts to authenticate a user's login using the provided credentials. Upon successful authentication, the user's status is set to online within the database, and they become the current active user for the session.
      Parameters:
      username - The unique identifier of the user.
      password - The authentication password of the user.
      Returns:
      The authenticated user if credentials are valid, or null if authentication fails.

    • logout

      public void logout(RegisterUser user)
      Updates the user's status to offline in both the application session and the database.
      Parameters:
      user - The user who is to be logged out.

    • getCurrentUser

      public RegisterUser getCurrentUser()
      Retrieves the currently logged-in user for the session.
      Returns:
      The current user.

    • getUserByUsername

      public RegisterUser getUserByUsername(String username)
      Queries the database to retrieve details of a user based on their unique username.
      Parameters:
      username - The unique identifier of the desired user.
      Returns:
      A RegisterUser object containing details of the user if found, or null if not present.
